channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The world’s richest woman just joined the $100 billion club
item.description: Walmart heiress Alice Walton is a newly-minted member of the centi-billion club.

item.title: Live Updates: U.S. Pushes Cease-Fire in Lebanon as Netanyahu Says Israel Will Fight On
item.description: The Israeli leader was heading to New York for talks. He did not comment on the proposal to pause fighting with Hezbollah, but instructed Israeli forc...

item.title: Why Curbing Hezbollah’s Power in Lebanon Just Became Harder
item.description: The militant group is a dominant force in the country, and officials have struggled for decades to limit its power.

item.title: After 44 Years on Death Row, Japanese Man Is Exonerated at Age 88
item.description: Iwao Hakamada is believed to be the world’s longest-serving inmate given a death sentence.

item.title: Israel’s Displaced Want to Go Home. But Will Attacks on Hezbollah Offer That Path?
item.description: Israel said the goal of its strikes on Hezbollah was to allow residents of the north to go home. Some are hopeful that plan will work, but others worr...

item.title: Republican Candidates Keep Straying Into Dangerous Territory: Abortion
item.description: In a campaign they would like to center on the economy and the border, Republican candidates keep drifting back to abortion rights, an issue that favo...

item.title: Elon Musk lashes out at U.K. government after being snubbed from top investment summit over race riot posts
item.description: It is understood that Musk wasn't added to the list after he weighed into race riots in the U.K. over the summer.

item.title: Chinese leaders admit world’s second-largest economy faces new ‘problems,’ giving hope that more support is on the way
item.description: Beijing this week unveiled measures to boost its ailing economy and hit a 5% growth target—an objective analysts say is optimistic.

item.title: Smartmatic-Newsmax Defamation Case Heads to Trial
item.description: Smartmatic, an election technology company, has accused the right-wing cable news channel of knowingly spreading false vote-rigging claims.

item.title: Federal judge approves Norfolk Southern’s $600 million settlement for residents near fiery Ohio derailment
item.description: Roughly 55,000 claims were filed. Only 370 households and 47 businesses opted out.

item.title: Why Curbing Hezbollah’s Power in Lebanon Just Became Harder
item.description: The militant group is a dominant force in the country, and officials have struggled for decades to limit its power.

item.title: Eric Adams Is Indicted, and Florida Braces for Hurricane Helene
item.description: Plus, the “snackification” of the American diet.

item.title: Biden to Meet Zelensky After Pledging More Weapons and Aid to Ukraine
item.description: The Ukrainian leader is expected to present the president a new “victory plan.” He also plans to meet with Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: Dozens, Mostly Children, Drown During a Hindu Festival
item.description: At least 46 died in a ceremony that involves bathing in local rivers and streams in Bihar State, where recent rains had raised water levels.

item.title: Adrian Cheng, member of one of Asia’s richest families, resigns as New World CEO after the Hong Kong developer posts $2.5 billion loss
item.description: His resignation adds to questions over succession at the Cheng family conglomerate, whose business also spans from jewelry to logistics.
